archimate:BusinessObject.name: Network and Information Systems 2 Directive (NIS2)
archimate:BusinessObject.documentation: DIRECTIVE (EU) 2022/2555 OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL on measures for a high common level of cyber security throughout the Union, amending Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 and Directive (EU) 2018/1972 and repealing Directive (EU) The expansion of the number of sectors means that the entire regulation becomes significantly larger and includes more actors who must live up to a higher level of requirements in order to avoid greater sanctions. The directive involves an update of the existing legal framework for which measures can be taken to counter the increased information and cyber security threat. NIS2- The directive requires that the member states have a national strategy and how it is designed, but also a requirement for a crisis management framework. the directive forms part of a package of measures aimed at further improving the robustness and resilience of both the digital and physical infrastructure of both public and private businesses, competent authorities and the Union as a whole. Implementation of the EU directive on measures for a high common level of cyber security throughout the Union and the EU directive on the resilience of critical entities.
